title: Strictly Come Dancing's Karim Zeroual is still dancing tonight
text:
Strictly Come Dancing contestant Karim Zeroual and his professional dance partner Amy Dowden will be dancing tonight as planned (Picture: PA)

Great news Strictly fans, Karim Zeroual will be hitting the dance floor on tonight’s show as planned.

There had been concerns for the CBBC presenter’s performance after he was struck down with the flu earlier this week and had to pull out of his planned appeared on It Takes Two.

But thankfully the standout contestant was feeling well enough to take part in the show’s dress rehearsal on Friday and he is all set to hit the stage and perform the Tango to George Ezra’s Paradise.

Fans got worried after the presenter and his dance partner Amy Dowden were unable to rehearse for their upcoming performance because he had ‘the lurgy’.

Amy was on hand to represent the pair on the Strictly spin-off show, but she expressed concern that they both have a lot of work to do to make sure they’re ready for their performance.

She told host Zoe Ball: ‘He’s so disappointed not to be here. We’re a day down and he’s had a busy work schedule so we haven’t been able to put in hours.

The CBBC presenter has had a rocky week after falling ill with the flu (Picture: PA)

‘We’ve still got a lot to do technically, and I’ve gotta try and get the smile off his face. Hopefully he’s feeling better and he can go for it.’

Karim is currently one of the favourites to lift the glitterball this year after some impressive performances.

Karim and Amy will be dancing the Tango to George Ezra’s (Picture: PA)

After the second week of Strictly the pair topped the leaderboard with a fabulous 32 points for their foxtrot, getting some glowing feedback from the judges – particularly Shirley Ballas.

Not only that, Karim’s odds of lifting the glitterball trophy have been slashed, bringing him closer to the current favourite, Emmerdale actor Kelvin Fletcher.

This weekend’s Strictly will see Catherine Tyldesley taking on a Charleston, Mike Bushell quickstepping to Come On Eileen, and Saffron Barker attempting contemporary dance in the second Couple’s Choice of the series.
description: Karim Zeroual will be hitting the dance floor on tonight's Strictly Come Dancing live show after falling ill with the flu earlier this week.
